title: Nominations for National Civil Awards in Science and Technology reviewed
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 03 (APP):A high-level meeting to review nominations for the prestigious National Civil Awards was convened at the Cabinet Division under the chairmanship of Federal Minister for Science and Technology, Khalid Hussain Magsi.
The session focused on evaluating the contributions of eminent professionals in the fields of science, technology, education, and engineering.
Federal Secretary for Science and Technology, Mr Sajid Baloch, senior ministry officials, and domain experts participated in the meeting to assess potential awardees for presidential honors.
Addressing the gathering, Minister Khalid Magsi reaffirmed the government’s commitment to merit, transparency, and the celebration of excellence. “Recognizing the tireless efforts of our scientists, researchers, and engineers not only honors their achievements but also motivates the youth to pursue innovation and knowledge,” he said.
The participants held comprehensive deliberations on the accomplishments and public service contributions of the nominees. It was agreed that formal recommendations would be finalized and forwarded to the competent authorities, following the prescribed procedures.
